Test.Description:
We don't have direct access to atomic actions like store or use so we just trigger them with less atomic actions and check the expected induced consequences.
We also have no sure method to trigger prescient store mechanism in these tests, but at least can check the correctness of outcome regardless of whether prescient store occured or not.
The test makes an assignment to A, unlocks a lock to force a store operation on A and throws an Exception. After that the test checks the local copy of A to be equal to what it has assigned to it. Wrong value treated as a failure to perform a required assign operation.
The test is repeated until the time specified by delay parameter elapses.
